alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 5:40PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Georgia, including the following counties, Calhoun, Clay, Quitman and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cuthbert, Georgetown, Shellman, Coles, Peterson Hill, Randolph Co A/p, Springvale Station, Springvale, White House, Coleman, Morris, Cotton Hill, Carnegie, Shivers Mill, Goffs Mill, Garnersville, Pachitla, Crossroads, Moores Crossroads and Watson Crossroads. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
